intro: Haemadictyon denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, finely toothed leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its unique leaf morphology and flowering structure.
